name: Superfish Inc.
description: Superfish Visual Search root CA installed by Lenovo on consumer laptops. Enables TLS interception via self-signed proxy certificates. Private key was trivially extractable.

name: eDellRoot
description: Dell self-signed root CA pre-installed on Dell systems. Private key was embedded in the certificate store and identical across all affected machines.

name: DSDTestProvider (eDellRoot variant)
description: Another Dell self-signed root CA (DSD Test Provider) found on Dell systems with similar private key exposure issues.

name: Komodia SSL Digestor
description: Komodia SSL Digestor root CA used by multiple ad-injection and parental control products to perform TLS interception. Known weak implementation with shared private keys.

name: PrivDog
description: PrivDog ad-replacement software root CA that replaced website ads with its own. Contained critical TLS validation vulnerability.

name: Sennheiser HeadSetup
description: Sennheiser HeadSetup software installed a root CA with an extractable private key for local TLS communication. Same certificate and key used across all installations.

name: Sennheiser HeadSetup (CA 2)
description: Second Sennheiser HeadSetup root certificate with same private key exposure vulnerability.

name: CNNIC ROOT
description: China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC) root CA. Distrusted by major browsers after an intermediate CA issued unauthorized certificates for Google domains.

name: WoSign Root CA
description: WoSign root CA distrusted by major browsers due to multiple certificate mis-issuance incidents and backdating SHA-1 certificates.

name: StartCom Certification Authority
description: StartCom root CA distrusted by major browsers due to shared infrastructure and control with WoSign.

name: Ad-Aware Web Companion
description: Lavasoft Ad-Aware Web Companion root CA used for TLS interception. Uses Komodia SDK with known weak cryptographic implementation.

name: Wajam
description: Wajam Internet Technologies root CA installed by Wajam social search adware for TLS interception.

name: Gogo Inflight Internet
description: Gogo in-flight WiFi root CA used for TLS interception of passenger internet traffic.

name: Samsung KNOX
description: Samsung KNOX enterprise root CA found pre-installed on some Samsung consumer devices outside of managed enterprise deployments.
